sentence.Network_en: I'm a limited and obtuse clergyman while you're the expert.
sentence.Network_cn: 你是专家，而我是个能力有限的愚笨牧师。

sentence.Network_en: The 69-year-old clergyman escaped with superficial wounds.
sentence.Network_cn: 69岁的牧师幸免于难，只受了点皮肉伤。

sentence.Network_en: A clergyman read the liturgy from the prayer-book.
sentence.Network_cn: 一名牧师照着祈祷书念祷文。

entry.def: A clergyman is a male member of the clergy.

means.word_mean: 1. a member of the clergy and a spiritual leader of the Christian Church

sentences.en: A clergyman friend of the family conducted the funeral.
sentences.cn: 这家人的一位牧师朋友主持了这场葬礼。

sentences.en: The man was polite and his general demeanour had the air of a clergyman.
sentences.cn: 那男人彬彬有礼,一举一动都有教士的风度。
